name: ANNKE

”Alexa, Show the baby room”
”Alexa, Show the front door”

skdetail:
Smart Home Skill. This skill may share device information with Amazon. Learn more.
Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Developer Terms of Use
des:
With ANNKE skill and Alexa, you can now interact with your ANNKE connected cameras using your voice. This skill supports the products of Annke Nova series. 
*Note: Camera image encryption must be disabled to work with Alexa

Follow the steps below to setup your camera and link your ANNKE account:
1. From the Annke Nova Mobile App, select a suitable name for your camera (i.e., baby room, front door, etc.)
2. From the Annke Nova Mobile App, disable Image Encryption for the camera you wish to setup
3. From your Alexa App, search for ANNKE, enable the skill and link it to your ANNKE account by signing in with your ANNKE account
4. Discover your cameras by asking Alexa “Discover devices” or by pressing the Discover Devices button in the Alexa app

Once your account is linked, viewing your cameras is supported on Amazon Echo Show, Echo Spot, Fire TV, 2nd Gen Fire Stick or Fire Tablets (7th gen and above). To see your camera, just say “Alexa, show the (camera name)” 

Some important notes: 
1. Before connecting to Amazon Echo Show, Echo Spot or Fire TV, log in to your Annke Nova App and go to the camera settings. Look for “Image Encryption” and tap to turn it off. Tap “OK” when the prompt appears. Enter the Verification Code to apply the change.
2. How to change the name of your Annke Nova camera: Once the camera has been added to your ANNKE account, you can change its name in the Annke Nova camera settings page. Select a suitable name for your camera, such as “baby room” or “front door.” 
3. You can view live feeds from Annke Nova cameras on your Amazon Echo Show or Fire TV by saying the command “Alexa, show the (camera name).” 

For additional information and resources, please visit ANNKE online at www.annke.com/kb, or contact our support team at support@annke.com.
